benchmark_details.name: AUCAD (Automated Construction of Alignment Dataset from Log-Related Issues)
benchmark_details.overview: The AUCAD method automates the construction of a high-quality alignment dataset designed to enhance the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) in generating log statements by extracting information from log-related issues in open-source communities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To construct a high-quality post-training dataset for enhancing LLM-based log statement generation.

data.source: Log-related issues extracted from the Apache open-source community and their associated GitHub commits.
data.annotation: Automatically constructed and structured from log-related issues.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on comparisons between generated log statements and ground truth references.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in terms of generating relevant log statements.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparative evaluations against models fine-tuned without the AUCAD dataset.
methodology.validation: Validated through both human and experimental evaluations.
